subject: Politics
title: Power Corrupts
description: A fast breakdown of Power Corrupts for builders.

hook.text: Lord Acton wrote: 'Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.' History proves him right.

buildup.text: Psychological studies show that power reduces empathy. People in power stop seeing things from others' perspectives.

discovery.text: The Stanford Prison Experiment showed ordinary people become cruel when given authority over others.

twist.text: Power doesn't just corrupt bad people. It changes good people. The position itself rewires behavior.

climax.text: That's why checks and balances exist. Institutions must constrain power because human nature can't be trusted alone.

punchline.text: Power changes people. Good systems assume that and plan for it.

quiz.question: What did the Stanford Prison Experiment demonstrate about power?
options: Ordinary people can become cruel when given authority over others
Power has no effect on human behavior
Only naturally cruel people seek positions of power
